structural_fidelity.justification: The benchmark retains the original code's structure and logic, including the recursive functions and overall design with minimal alterations.

targeted_isolation.justification: The benchmark solely focuses on the optimization of the powering function with intrinsic capability, effectively isolating the optimization target.

side_effect_preservation.justification: Generally preserves contextual integrity; any undeclared side effects are unlikely because the benchmark focuses on pure functions, aside from preprocessor directives.

correctness_and_equivalence.justification: The benchmark correctly replicates the functionality of the original powering calculation using the intrinsic if available while maintaining equivalent output results.

computational_realism.justification: Realistically represents computational workloads by incorporating both integral and double precision exponentiation relevant to real-world usage.

context_neutrality.justification: Naming conventions are appropriate, with only minor indications within comments to suggest compile-time checks for constant expressions, maintaining neutrality.
